skill.description: Frontend coding standards, component patterns, and design system for the Guessimate Angular UI. Reference when writing or reviewing frontend code.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation (SKILL.md) with frontend coding standards. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands detected. Pure reference documentation for Angular and TailwindCSS development.

content.value_statement: Developers need consistent coding conventions to maintain code quality across Angular projects. This skill provides standardized patterns for components, state management, and TailwindCSS styling to ensure consistency and maintainability.
actual_capabilities: Defines Angular 20 component standards including standalone components and control flow syntax
Provides TailwindCSS 4 semantic color palette with light and dark mode support
Establishes feature-based project structure and naming conventions
Documents Signal-based state management patterns using Angular Signals
Specifies dependency injection patterns using inject() function
Defines consistent UI component patterns for cards, typography, and layouts
limitations: Does not provide executable code or build configurations
Does not include testing patterns or test setup guidance
Does not cover backend integration or API design patterns
Specific to Guessimate project context and may require adaptation for other projects

use_cases.title: New component creation
use_cases.description: When creating new Angular components, apply the style guide patterns for consistency with existing codebase.

use_cases.title: Pull request reviews
use_cases.description: Review frontend code changes against established conventions for naming, styling, and state management.

use_cases.title: Frontend code generation
use_cases.description: Generate Angular code that follows project conventions including Signals, standalone components, and TailwindCSS styling.

prompt_templates.title: Create component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Angular standalone component following the ui-style-guide. Use Signals for state, inject() for DI, TailwindCSS for styling, and the new control flow syntax.

prompt_templates.title: Add state management
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a Signal-based store service following the ui-style-guide patterns. Include computed selectors and update methods with immutable state updates.

prompt_templates.title: Style components
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply TailwindCSS styling to this component using the semantic color palette from ui-style-guide. Include dark mode support and proper surface/border classes.

prompt_templates.title: Review code
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Angular code against ui-style-guide standards. Check naming conventions, component structure, DI patterns, and TailwindCSS usage. Suggest specific improvements.

best_practices: Use standalone components with explicit imports and inline templates for better colocation of logic and view
Apply semantic color names (surface, brand, success, danger) instead of hardcoded color values for maintainability
Prefer Angular Signals over RxJS for local state, reserving Observables for async streams and external data
anti_patterns: Avoid constructor injection when inject() provides better type inference and cleaner syntax
Do not use external CSS files when TailwindCSS utility classes can keep styles co-located with markup
Avoid magic numbers in styling; use theme values like p-4 instead of p-[16px]

faq.question: Which Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: Angular 19+ is required. Standalone components are the default in v19+ and must be used.

faq.question: Can I use regular CSS instead of TailwindCSS?
faq.answer: No. TailwindCSS is mandatory for all styling. Use semantic color variables and utility classes only.

faq.question: How do I handle dark mode?
faq.answer: Use the dark: modifier prefix on all color-related classes. Test both light and dark modes for every component.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads documentation. No data is collected, stored, or transmitted. It only provides coding guidance.

faq.question: Why is my component not following conventions?
faq.answer: Check for constructor injection (should use inject()), missing dark: modifiers, or hardcoded color values instead of semantic names.

faq.question: How does this compare to official Angular style guide?
faq.answer: This guide extends the official Angular style guide with project-specific conventions for Guessimate's architecture and design system.
